intro: Rhexia crassifolia, commonly known as broadleaf rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a glossy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers in the summer. Rhexia crassifolia is often found in wetlands and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
